intro.para: Here we introduce the ‘epsilon-delta’ definition of continuity. It goes back to Bernard Bolzano in 1817. We establish the continuity of certain key functions, namely constant functions, inclusion functions, and the inverse function p(x)=1/x. In subsequent sections these form the inputs into operations which generate new continuous functions from given ones.
Then we show that continuity may alternately be characterized by the limit condition \lim_{n\to \infty}f(t_n)=f(x) whenever \lim_{n\to\infty} t_n = x.
